sen.j: 宗形 徳善（むなかた の とくぜん）は、福岡県宗像地方の豪族。
sen.e: MUNAKATA no Tokuzen was a local ruling family in the Munakata region, Fukuoka Prefecture.
MUNAKATA no Tokuzen was a local ruling family in the Munakata region, Fukuoka Prefecture.
MUNAKATA no Tokuzen was a local ruling family in the Munakata region, Fukuoka Prefecture.

sen.j: 「宗形」は、「宗像」とも、「胸形」とも、「胸方」とも、「胸肩」とも表記する。
sen.e: Munakata (宗形) can also be written as "宗像", "胸形", "胸方", or "胸肩" in Chinese character.
Munakata (宗形) can also be written as "宗像", "胸形", "胸方", or "胸肩" in Chinese characters.
Munakata (宗形) can also be written as '宗像,' '胸形,' '胸方,' or '胸肩' in Chinese characters.

sen.j: 天武天皇の妃尼子娘の父。
sen.e: He was a father of Amakonoiratsume, a consort of Emperor Tenmu.
He was the father of Amakonoiratsume, a consort of Emperor Tenmu.
He was the father of Amakonoiratsume, a consort of Emperor Tenmu.

sen.j: 阿田加多須命の子孫という。
sen.e: He is believed to be a descendant of Atakatasumikoto.
sen.cmt: 阿田加多須命：あたかたすみこと<http://blogs.yahoo.co.jp/dokatakayo/23650428.html>
sen.e: He is believed to be a descendant of Atakatasumikoto.
He is believed to be a descendant of Atakatasumikoto.

sen.j: 父を高丸と伝える史料や元麿と伝える史料もあるが、いずれも信憑性がない。
sen.e: Some historical materials say that his father was Takamaru and the others says he was Motomaro, but in any case, there is no credibility.
Some historical material say that his father was Takamaru and the others says he was Motomaro, but in any case, there is no credibility.
Some historical material say that his father was Takamaru and the others says he was Motomaro, but in any case, there is no credibility.

sen.j: 子孫は宗像大社の神主を世襲した。
sen.e: His offspring succeeded to a priest of the Munakata-taisha Shrine.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: His offspring succeeded to a priest of the Munakata-taisha Shrine.
His offspring succeeded to a priest of the Munakata-taisha Shrine.

sen.j: 醍醐天皇の頃、宇多天皇の子光遠親王に神主職を譲り、親王は宗形清氏と改名して大宮司職（神主）についたという。
sen.e: It is said that, in the era of Emperor Daigo, the post of the Shinto priest was handed over to Imperial Prince Koen, a son of Emperor Uda and then the Imperial Prince changed his name to MUNAKATA no Kiyouji to serve as Daiguji (the supreme priest).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処重複になるので「（神主）」は訳していません。
sen.e: It is said that, in the era of Emperor Daigo, the post of the Shinto priest was handed over to Imperial Prince Koen, a son of Emperor Uda and then the Imperial Prince changed his name to MUNAKATA no Kiyouji to serve as Daiguji (the supreme priest).

It is said that, in the era of Emperor Daigo, the post of the Shinto priest was handed over to Imperial Prince Koen, a son of Emperor Uda and then the Imperial Prince changed his name to MUNAKATA no Kiyouji to serve as Daiguji (the supreme priest).

sen.j: （なお、光遠親王は宗像大社初代大宮司の清氏を崇高するための架空の人物という説もある）。
sen.e: (It is also said that the Imperial Prince Koen is a fictitious person created to revere Kiyouji, the first Daiguji of the Munakata-taisha Shrine.)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: (It is also said that the Imperial Prince Koen is a fictitious person created to revere Kiyouji, the first Daiguji of the Munakata-taisha Shrine.)
(It is also said that the Imperial Prince Koen is a fictitious person created to revere Kiyouji, the first Daiguji of the Munakata-taisha Shrine.)

sen.j: 宗像大領と伝えるものもあるが信用性に乏しい。
sen.e: Some says that the first Daiguji was Dairyo (Chief district official) of Munakata, but it has no credibility.
Some says that the first Daiguji was Dairyo (Chief district official) of Munakata, but it has no credibility.
Some says that the first Daiguji was Dairyo (Chief district official) of Munakata, but it has no credibility.
